title: Lotusden Halfling
entryLore: Lotusden halflings are native to the Lotusden Greenwood of Exandria, where they have developed a deep connection to the natural world and druidic magic. Living in harmony with the forest, they possess innate abilities to communicate with nature and call upon plant life for protection. Their communities are well-hidden among the trees, and they serve as guardians of the woodland realms.

lore.typicalDwelling: Lotusden halflings dwell in the sun-dappled reaches of ancient, primeval forests, misty woodlands, or overgrown ruins. Their homes are integrated into the living tapestry of the woods, often featuring treetop villages, camouflaged ground-complexes, and central halls with high, leaf-covered canopies. They value structural harmony and a clear view of the surrounding territory, their dwellings often doubling as watchtowers for communal safety. Their settlements are monuments to their patience and their ancestor's mastery over the deep wild.
lore.typicalAttire: Lotusden halflings favor attire that is both durable and functional, reflecting their guardian-like and nature-touched nature. They wear oil-treated leathers, heavy fabrics in shades of forest green, deep moss, and charcoal gray, often decorated with bone or ivory tokens. Their clothing is designed to be easily shed or cleaned of mud and forest-debris. Many wear simple, practical sashes and belts for carrying specialized hunting tools and defensive gear. Their appearance is always disciplined and intimidating, their gear kept in peak condition.
lore.typicalEnvironment: Ancient forests, misty moorlands, and any region that rewards agility, stealth, and quick thinking are the preferred habitats for lotusden halflings. They thrive in environments where they can utilize their natural resistance to environmental hazards and their predatory patience. Many serve as specialized scouts, professional hunters, elite bodyguards, or specialized soldiers. They are comfortable in high humidity and are often the only inhabitants of regions others find too unpredictable for established life.
lore.societyType: Halfling society with lotusden heritage is intensely hierarchical and organized around shared tradition and the sentinel-style order of the tribe. They value discipline, loyalty, and the pursuit of excellence in the hunting and defense of their community. Leadership is held by those who have demonstrated the greatest tactical brilliance or the most successful application of their natural gifts in the protection of the woods. Their culture is one of collective pride and the belief that vigilance is the only defense against the chaos of the world.
lore.typicalAssociation: Lotusden halflings tend toward neutral or lawful alignments, driven by a pragmatic focus on survival and a commitment to the absolute order of their predatory lifestyle. They are a stoic and often suspicious people, viewing outsiders as potential threats or unworthy intrusions into their domain. However, they are intensely loyal to their companions and honor their word with a grim seriousness that is legendary among their kind.
lore.physicalAppearance: Lotusden halflings possess an imposing and predatory appearance, standing 3 feet tall with powerful, well-defined builds. Their skin range through human norms but often features a deep, forest green or mossy emerald hue. Their faces are refined and characterized by high brow ridges and large, expressive eyes that convey an intense concentration. They possess little body hair, often presenting a smooth and polished appearance. Their movements are characterized by a total absence of wasted motion, every gesture deliberate and precisely calculated. They move with an almost mechanical grace that conveys absolute control over their own bodies. Their presence is tranquil and anchors the space around them, a visible manifestation of their internal clarity and unyielding power.

traits.name: Lucky
traits.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
traits.description: You have [[advantage]] on saving throws against being [[frightened]].

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Child of the Wood
traits.description: You know the [[druidcraft|Druidcraft]] cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the [[entangle|Entangle]] spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a [[long_rest|Long Rest]]. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the [[spike_growth|Spike Growth]] spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a Long Rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Timberwalk
traits.description: Ability checks made to track you have [[disadvantage]], and you can move across difficult terrain made of nonmagical plants and undergrowth without expending extra movement.
